page.title: 01Swanton Morley . 1
page.content:
Swanton Morley is a large, well scattered village. In common with many Norfolk villages, it has a wide variety of housing ranging from tied farm cottages to modern estates of private homes.
The older part of the village surrounds a small village green and overlooks the flood plain of the River Wensum. This is the focal point of the village still, and here are to be found All Saints church, the village hall (formerly the school until 1917), a general stores, butcher, greengrocer, bakery and one of the two village public houses. The character of the village has been changed by the development of a nearby R.A.F. base involved in service research.
